task.title: Troubleshoot Circuit Humming
task.shortdesc: Identify and fix grounding issues that cause a continuous humming noise in your guitar's output.

prereq.p: You need a soldering iron heated to 650-700Â°F and desoldering wick or pump.

substep.cmd: Inspect all solder joints on grounding wires for cold solder joints.
substep.info: Cold solder joints appear dull, grainy, or blobbed.

substep.stepresult: The humming should stop if this was the cause.

substep.cmd: Verify the bridge ground wire is soldered to the back of the volume pot casing.
Inspect the connection point between the bridge ground wire and the bridge for debris or corrosion.
Clean any debris or resolder the connection if the solder joint is cold.
substep.stepresult: The humming should stop if this was the cause.

result.p: The humming noise is eliminated once you fix the grounding issue.
